intro: Stahl Speech and Language Therapy LLC is a small private practice serving the greater Washington, D.C. area. With Stahl Speech, you can be confident that your child is receiving exceptional and tailored speech therapy that will help your child become an effective communicator.
bio: Alexandra “Ally” Stahl is a speech-language pathologist with 10 years of experience working with the pediatric population. After earning her masters at University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, she completed her clinical fellowship at an early intervention practice in Raleigh, NC. She spent the next 9 years at an outpatient center for Children’s National Hospital in Rockville, MD.

Ally has experience diagnosing and treating mixed receptive-expressive language disorders, expressive language delays, and higher-order language disorders. However, she specializes in pediatric speech sound disorders including childhood apraxia of speech and phonological disorders.  Ally is trained in Dynamic Temporal and Tactile Cueing (DTTC) and PROMPT. She is recognized by Apraxia Kids and the Once Upon a Time Foundation as a speech-language pathologist with additional training required for diagnosing and treating childhood apraxia of speech. Ally was also a part of the Velopharyngeal Insufficiency (VPI) clinic at Children’s National, assessing and treating hypernasal resonance associated with VPI. While Ally’s experience has predominantly been with pediatric speech and language disorders, she has additional training targeting accent modification with adults.
Ally lives in Kensington, MD with her husband, daughter, and dog. Ally played Division I tennis while at Radford University and continues to be an avid tennis player.

faq.question: Do you accept insurance?
answer: We are out-of-network with all insurance companies. It is highly recommended that you contact your health insurance company before your evaluation and/or treatment to determine if you are able to get reimbursed. We are happy to provide you a list of codes to inquire about.
For all services rendered, we will provide an itemized bill that includes applicable diagnostic and procedural codes. This superbill can be submitted to insurance for reimbursement.

faq.question: What are your fees?
answer: We will provide a 15-minute complimentary virtual consultation.
Please contact our office to learn about out-of-pocket costs for speech therapy, screeners, and evaluations.

faq.question: How long will my child need therapy?
answer: Unfortunately, this is very hard to predict as there are many different factors at play. Every child is unique and responds to therapy differently. However, we can guarantee at Stahl Speech that we will provide tailored speech therapy that is designed to meet your child at their current level of development. We will help work with you and your child to help them grow and become effective communicators.
